items.title: PM announces review of intelligence and law enforcement in wake of Bondi attack
items.description: Former top bureaucrat Dennis Richardson has been appointed to lead the review, which will report in April of next year.

items.title: Live: 'Use your kindness': Governor-General urges for peace on Bondi Day of Reflection
items.description: A National Day of Reflection is being held, as people across the country are invited to light a candle at 6:47pm, one week since the attack. Follow Live.

items.title: In the darkest week, Bondi's Jewish community looks for the light
items.description: As Sydney marks one week since the antisemitic Bondi attack, the Jewish community is grappling with the question of where to go from here.

items.title: Why the 'bystander effect' didn't stop people from acting at Bondi
items.description: Experts advise to "escape, hide, and tell" in a terrorist attack. These men and women did otherwise and saved lives when gunmen opened fire at Bondi Beach.

items.title: Why the contrast between Minns and Albanese has been so stark
items.description: As Sydneysiders paid their respects to the Bondi terror victims, one moment captured the contrast between two Labor leaders and their perceived responses to antisemitism.

items.title: 'Another level of betrayal': Survivors search the Epstein files to find nothing
items.description: Despite giving an FBI interview and victim statement, Epstein victim Jess Michaels finds no trace of her evidence in the vast trove published online.

items.title: Images removed from Epstein files less than a day after being posted
items.description: At least 16 Jeffrey Epstein-related files, including a photo of US President Donald Trump, disappear from a US Department of Justice webpage within a day of being posted, with no explanation.

items.title: Who's named in the Epstein files and who else was he connected to?
items.description: The Epstein files offer another glimpse into the financier's vast network of wealthy and influential figures. Here's what we know about his relationships with some of the world's most powerful people.

items.title: Live: Marnus pulls of another miracle catch as Australia finally breaks through
items.description: Ashes victory is in sight for Australia on day five of the third Test, with England in need of a miracle to avoid going 3-0 down at the Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

items.title: 'I didn't agree to it': Rise of automatic tipping sparks backlash
items.description: Australia's tipping culture is in the spotlight, following reports more businesses are adding automatic tips to diners' bills in response to rising operating costs.

items.title: Woman allegedly assaulted at popular Gold Coast national park
items.description: Police are appealing for information after a woman was allegedly assaulted in broad daylight on a popular Gold Coast walking track.

items.title: Retirement dreams shattered after paying $84k for a never-built house
items.description: Multiple people are speaking out about their experience paying too much to a building company for work never delivered.

items.title: NT government pulls funding for puberty blockers, hormones for children
items.description: Northern Territory Health Minister Steve Edgington announces the withdrawal of public funding for puberty blockers and hormone treatments for children, labelling them "dangerous, ideologically driven practices".

items.title: Baker went to jail in 1977 so you can enjoy fresh bread at weekends
items.description: Richard Warby still remembers the day his local community piled into a mini-bus bound for Long Bay Jail to pay a fine and release his father, who was locked up for the bizarre crime of baking bread on a weekend.

items.title: Approaching her 80th birthday, Joan Jeffery is still riding high
items.description: While many people entering their 80s are struggling with physical or mental limitations, Joan Jeffery still manages to do all the heavy lifting of caring for a horse.

items.title: Teen sensation Indra Brown claims historic silver in freeski halfpipe
items.description: Melbourne 15-year-old Indra Brown claims her second medal in her World Cup debut in the freeski halfpipe.

items.title: US strikes kill at least five IS members in Syria, monitor says
items.description: The operation employed more than 100 precision munitions targeting known IS infrastructure and weapons sites, according to a US Centcom statement.

items.title: 'A big storm day': Tornadoes possible as wild weather hits Victoria
items.description: Victorians are being urged to brace for destructive storms on Sunday afternoon, with intense rainfall and damaging winds forecast in the state's north while an extreme fire warning remains in place for the north-west.

items.title: An algorithm said Lina would be safe. Then she was murdered
items.description: In Spain, police have developed technology to work out how at-risk women might be from domestic violence. Some people have grave concerns about how often the algorithm is wrong.

items.title: Small regional charity stops thousands of Nepali girls being trafficked
items.description: After hearing harrowing stories of abuse against young Nepalese women and girls, Port Macquarie man Ross Nancarrow wanted to help.

items.title: Paraplegic engineer becomes the first wheelchair user to blast into space
items.description: The flight was just 10 minutes but the capsule still managed to soar 105 kilometres up, skimming into space.

items.title: Paul calls out star boxer despite suffering double broken jaw in defeat
items.description: Jake Paul calls out Canelo Alvarez as the American recovers from a double broken jaw from his controversial fight with Anthony Joshua.

items.title: The fight to save Australia's disappearing beaches
items.description: Most Australians live by the beach, but the coastline we have built our lives around is disappearing before our eyes.

items.title: Mail sorting on vacant block leaves residents getting bills weeks late
items.description: Residents of a popular north Queensland suburb say they are receiving bills and overdue notices on the same day.

items.title: After a million kilometres, stock agent retires LandCruiser 4WD
items.description: A Victorian stock agent's four-wheel drive LandCruiser has reached a rare milestone, as experts say Australians are keeping their cars longer than ever.
